name: should use default from table when sorting by fantasy points from plays that is not in selected columns
description: Regression test: sorting by player_fantasy_points_from_plays without selecting it as a column should fall back to the default player FROM table instead of referencing an undefined CTE. Previously, the FROM table optimization would generate a CTE table alias but the CTE WITH clause was never added because the column was not in the selected columns.
expected_query: with "t34a85301ab31b3447846ec8d43908764" as (select "nfl_plays"."off", COUNT(*) as rate_type_total_count from "nfl_plays" where not "play_type" = 'NOPL' and "play_type" = 'PASS' and "nfl_plays"."year" in (2025) and "nfl_plays"."seas_type" in ('REG') group by "nfl_plays"."off"), "t49c02ac946e4ed84963e5135fafc88e7" as (select COALESCE(psr_pid) as pid, SUM(CASE WHEN psr_pid IS NOT NULL AND (sk IS NULL OR sk = false) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as pass_atts_from_plays from "nfl_plays" where not "play_type" = 'NOPL' and "nfl_plays"."year" in (2025) and "nfl_plays"."seas_type" in ('REG') group by COALESCE(psr_pid)) select "player"."pid", player.fname, player.lname, CAST(t49c02ac946e4ed84963e5135fafc88e7.pass_atts_from_plays AS DECIMAL) / NULLIF(CAST(t34a85301ab31b3447846ec8d43908764.rate_type_total_count AS DECIMAL), 0) AS "pass_atts_from_plays_0", "player"."pos" from "player" left join "t34a85301ab31b3447846ec8d43908764" on "t34a85301ab31b3447846ec8d43908764"."off" = "player"."current_nfl_team" left join "t49c02ac946e4ed84963e5135fafc88e7" on "t49c02ac946e4ed84963e5135fafc88e7"."pid" = "player"."pid" where player.pos IN ('QB') group by player.fname, player.lname, "t49c02ac946e4ed84963e5135fafc88e7"."pass_atts_from_plays", t34a85301ab31b3447846ec8d43908764.rate_type_total_count, "player"."pid", "player"."lname", "player"."fname", "player"."pos" order by "player"."pid" asc limit 500
